text.tspan: Kalman_1D - this filter is mainly to reduce
noise from a noisy data (such as sonar)
Kalman_2D - this filter is extended for
new estimate(Xhat) is a prediction(A) made from old estimate (Xhat)
new uncertainty/covariance is a prediction(A) made from old
known nonlinear general process and measurement
Compute the Kalman Gain from the uncertainty/covariance(P),
and also the observed sensor noise(R)
Update our estimate (Xhat) with the previous estimate
(Xhat) plus a correction term that is the Kalman Gain (K)
times a diference between our measurement and an observed
prediction that is the update times the previous estimate
Update the uncertainty/covariance using the Kalman Gain(K),
update matrix(C) and the old uncertainty (P)
can be a single value like 1
We don't assume anything about the
and driving forces of the quad and
as such we assume U = 0, for no correction
C or H in literature relates the current state to our new measurement
A is the prediction matrix/system matrix that relates the state at the last step to the current step
P is the uncertainty/covariance or the estimate errort
B is a correction/control matrix that influences the control U to adjust the state
U is a control vector used to adjust the state given changes in the system
We consider H is the same as A
matrix to be the same as
Q is the environmental influences/process noise
W is a jacobian to account for nonlinear influences from Q
updateState(since the noise changes and the model
we use needs to be computed every time:
